I think that generally the APS need to refine the overall value proposition regarding the benefits of the APS and to be able to adapt this to different points of need. This is particulary important when the brand of the APS is still developing and emerging. It is not yet well known enough to 'command' instant membership. A key part of that value proposition is what the Association is trying to do for the industry as a whole, which is fantastic and sometimes this is lost.  I also think Graham has a great opportunity to connect people across the APS network which is a key role for anyone managing relationships. This would be of great value.

Confirming meeting points in writing a bit quicker.More face to face time with the sales team to develop the profile of the APS in their eyes.Act as a 'door opener' by making the core cadre of APS more accessible and known to newer and potential members. I have nothing against Kelvin, but Royal Mail should offer a delivery service to every letterbox in a prescribed area that can be specified more flexibly than by the first part of a post code (i.e. XXn n--). This survey has come at a good time since the latest appalling way in which we have been treated by Royal Mail.

Last week our account was suspended without ANY warning, it was only until we tried to manifest at the end of the day we realised there was an issue that our payment was over due by 6 days.

This left us in dire straights & the 170 orders ready for dispatch that day did not leave us creating bedlam.

I firstly tried to call customer services who passed me to my account manager, thinking this would be the best port of call, he (Alex?) couldnt do anything for us, the only real info given was that this WOULD take 72 hours to fix & nothing could be done theres no flick of a switch, he hastily passed me through to the accounts team, passed the buck & thats the last I heard from him! since.

The accounts team were very blunt with no empathy or help whatsoever, just repeating the same line nothing can be done, it'll take 72 hours no flick of a switch, no concern in the slightest apart from to get me off the phone & to hell with my business!

I instantly cleared the entire balance, my company turns over Â£2m a year, the balance was no issue just an over sight with NO warning, no email, even during the setup we were told this could never happen.

This fobbing off happened repeatedly on numerous calls, my business that has taken 6 years to build was completely at your mercy & you couldn't give a toss, I was left up **** creek with no paddle I think is the term.

My business that has spent over Â£500,000 with you!!

We've recently moved to Click & Drop & must be nearing Â£100k py, yet for 5 years before this we were using the post office, buying stamps from Shiphay post office Torquay, see how there turnover has diminished since we moved to click & drop it will be very noticeable.

The arrears in which we received the suspension was approx Â£4,000

So finally, after emptying all the local post offices of stamps to try & clear the backlog of our orders & with the blind panic we had trying to fix this completely unnecessary & available mess, my store manager made one last plea & was lucky enough to speak to Carly Fletcher, who could see that we had paid & turned the account on again in an instant, in a flick of a switch.


She out of ALL I spoke to including my account manager was the only one who gave a damn & helped.


To further this, on numerous occasions the C&D has completely gone down on us leaving us in limbo on a number of occasions, we dont get any reprieve or apology when that happens & its frequent enough.


Now we have a new issue, since this episode the sorting office are now going through all of our mail, weighing it, sizing it & picking out anything which is wrong & stopping it. This never happened before, we are now targets.

The driver was told not to pick up from us after it was reinstated, they were so quick to suspend the account yet we had to physically tell him it was re-instated & show him our emails, luckily we caught him as he drove by.


So clearly after the whole embarrassment of looking like we cant pay (take into account our spend & turnover), the avoidable unsent post & the unnecessary blind panic to try & get our orders to our customers. 
Then clearly after all of this that you've dished out to us we are also now a target for the sorting office & they now have it in for us.
This is not how I would treat a customer paying Â£100k per year.


And to cap it off, the day after the suspension the 20th low & behold a letter dropped though the door saying payment reminder, sent a few days before on a 48hr post


Needless to say, yesterday I called DPD & DHL, ive got a call with MyHermes & Ipost later


Regards

Daniel Currey
DC Trading (sw) limited
